description.en-us: CTE-Arts, A/V Technology, and Communication Standards

competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
A/V Technology and Film
Demonstrate an understanding of the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Research the history of the audio and video technology and film career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the audio and video technology and film career pathway.
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster.
Research a career in the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Arts, A/V Technology & Communication career cluster.
Analyze careers in the visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting industry.
Describe careers in the design industry.
Classify careers from entry level to professional level.
Explore entrepreneurship opportunities in the design industry.
Research and present information on a design career to include roles and responsibilities, employment opportunities and requirements for education and training.
Develop a project related to visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting.
Select materials and supplies for a visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting project.
Calculate the costs of a given visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting project.
Interpret written directions for constructing a visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting project.
Apply mathematical skills and construct a visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting project.
Develop a project related to A/V technology, film, and printing technology.
Select materials and supplies for an A/V technology project.
Calculate the costs of a given A/V technology project.
Interpret written directions for constructing an A/V technology project.
Apply math skills and construct an A/V technology project.
Utilize technology as it relates to the A/V technology, film, and printing technology industries.
Identify technology utilized in the A/V technology, film, and printing technology industries.
Analyze technology trends impacting the A/V technology, film, and printing technology industries.
Utilize technology.
Utilize technology as it relates to the visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting industry.
Identify technology utilized in the visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting industry.
Analyze technology trends impacting the visual arts, performing arts, journalism and broadcasting industry.
Utilize technology.

Demonstrate knowledge of the history of fashion.
Explain how historical periods impact fashion.
Explain the impact of social changes, history, politics, and culture on fashion and fashion design.
Identify the factors that impact fashion choices.
Identify the characteristics and care of textiles.
Identify a variety of fabrics through tactile activities.

Recognize different types of fabric construction.
Identify the appropriate use or purpose of a variety of fabric types.
Explain the elements and principles of design.
